page.title: 16Leith Hall
page.content: Leith Hall was built in 1650 and originally belonged to the Leith-Hay family. It now belongs to the National Trust for Scotland. On average, between 30 and 40 visitors visit Leith Hall during a typical weekday in the tourist season and roughly 140 at a weekend. Leith Hall is only open to visitors from May until September, and during this period guides are employed to conduct visitors around the mansion. The building contains many fine examples of furniture, art, china and jewellery from days gone by. As well as viewing these items and listening to the history of the building and the Leith-Hay family, most visitors also take time to walk in the extensive and well kept gardens and footpaths through the woods which form a large part of the mansion's grounds.
